A transient event lasts a split-second and registers as a tap or impulse, whereas a continuous event feels like an extended buzz of longer duration.

# type

**Instance Property**

The type of the haptic event.

## Declaration

```swift
var type: CHHapticEvent.EventType { get }
```

## Discussion

An audio event can be one of two types: [doc://com.apple.corehaptics/documentation/CoreHaptics/CHHapticEvent/EventType/audioCustom] or [doc://com.apple.corehaptics/documentation/CoreHaptics/CHHapticEvent/EventType/audioContinuous]. Haptic events can be [doc://com.apple.corehaptics/documentation/CoreHaptics/CHHapticEvent/EventType/hapticTransient] or [doc://com.apple.corehaptics/documentation/CoreHaptics/CHHapticEvent/EventType/hapticContinuous]:



A transient event lasts a split-second and registers as a tap or impulse, whereas a continuous event feels like an extended buzz of longer duration.

## Categorizing Haptic Events

- **CHHapticEvent.EventType**: The types of audio and haptic event waveforms.
